description:
The best starting point to understand how programming languages work is to study interpreters, not compilers.

• We will to study a simple Lisp interpreter written in Python.

• We will see the following concepts applied in practice:

• Why program translators use an AST (Abstract Syntax Tree) to process code.

• How pattern matching can be applied to AST processing How a closure is implemented and used in an interpreter

 These concepts apply to most languages, compiled or interpreted!
title: PyCon Chile 2022 - Keynote: The art of the interpreter ★ Luciano Ramalho [EN]
